thread.title: Sutton manager Paul Doswell blasts Arsenal’s ‘bizarre James Bond’ security after FA Cup clash against Arsene Wenger’s men
thread.title_full: Sutton manager Paul Doswell blasts Arsenal’s ‘bizarre James Bond’ security after FA Cup clash against Arsene Wenger’s men

author: ashilton
title: Sutton manager Paul Doswell blasts Arsenal’s ‘bizarre James Bond’ security after FA Cup clash against Arsene Wenger’s men
text:
Comments PAUL DOWSELL was left proud as punch by his non-league heroes. 
But the Sutton boss was surprised by The Gunners’ strong-arm security measures, which he said were like a James Bond movie. Getty Images 10 Arsene Wenger’s Arsenal team arrived with an entourage 
Keep up to date with ALL the Arsenal news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
The two sides are separated by 105 places in the football pyramid but you would never have guessed that at times, as Arsenal avoided a massive banana skin thanks to goals from Lucas Perez and Theo Walcott. 
Arsenal arrived at Sutton’s Gander Green Lane with BODYGUARDS , while Arsene Wenger was nearly hit by a plastic bottle near full-time. Reuters Theo Walcott next to a minder as he makes his way into the stadium Reuters Kieran Gibbs on his way into Gander Green Lane stadium Reserve keeper Wayne Shaw eats a pie during the match on the Sutton United touchline Reuters Shkodran Mustafi ahead of facing Sutton in the FA Cup Theo Walcott signs Sutton players’ shirts in dressing room after Arsenal FA Cup win 
And he blasted the fans who ran on the pitch at full time , preventing his players from doing a lap of honour. 
He added: "It is a different world. My lot have to go to work tomorrow. 
"Arsenal arrived here with bodyguards, and they took over the tunnel and we did not even get the chance to say thank you to our supporters in the end. 
"It was bizarre seeing James Bond security but that's the world we live in. News Group Newspapers Ltd Paul Dowsell compared Arsenal's security to a James Bond Sutton United 0-2 Arsenal : Sutton’s magical FA Cup run is ended in gritty encounter 
"You saw some idiots here shouting and screaming at Arsene Wenger, and you have to be protected. 
"It was a shame my players could not do a lap of honour because of the idiots who came on the pitch. 
"Those were not real Sutton fans. It was disappointing at the end when they ran on. 
"The way I feel now can be summed up in five letters; proud. 
"I am very proud of them. We asked them to give us everything they had and they did exactly that." Related stories messing room Arsenal accused of lack of respect after leaving non-league Sutton's away changing room in a tip - and they even left milk on the radiator! Class act Arsenal to donate £50,000 to help beaten FA Cup opponents Sutton build classrooms and fix the loos He Shaw is hungry Sutton back-up keeper Wayne Shaw gives fans a laugh as he munches a pie during second half Gander Green invasion Sutton fans invade the pitch at Gander Green Lane after watching the biggest game in their club history against Arsenal Walk tall Sutton's Paul Doswell says 'it was a dream' to face Arsenal while Arsene Wenger admits minnows shocked him BIG MONEY SIGNING Theo Walcott signs Sutton players' shirts in dressing room after Arsenal's crushing FA Cup victory Five things we learnt Sutton 0 Arsenal 2: Theo Walcott scored his 100th goal to remind Arsene Wenger of scoring prowess DREAM TEAM RATINGS Sutton United v Arsenal: See who shone as the part-timers made Gunners work hard for victory HEADS HELD HIGH Sutton 0 Arsenal 2: United's magical FA Cup run ends as Theo Walcott bags his 100th club goal in gritty encounter 
Wenger hailed battling Sutton's performance on an uncomfortable night for the Arsenal boss and brushed off the bottle throwing incident. 
He said: "That was job done against a side that was astonishing. 
"It is basically division five and they are 17th out of 24. I will never go down there to manage because it is too difficult. 
"They surprised us with the speed of their game and the fact they never stopped going until the end. PA:Press Association A Sutton fan has to be escorted away by a policeman Reuters A fan tries to get a selfie with Alexis Sanchez at full-time Getty Images Fans crowd near the tunnel as the try to get close to Arsenal's stars Reuters One fan tries to climb onto the crossbar at Gander Green Lane Reuters 10 The fans were generally harmless though 
"Compared to 20 years ago, these teams are fit now and can play at the pace of the Premier League. 
"They kept going and we were never really in a position where we could really afford to have a little breather in the game. 
"We had to keep our focus, I must give credit to the players who were professional and kept their focus. 
"If we had come here in a relaxed mood, we would have gone out tonight because they produced quality." Ian Wright checks out the Sutton United players' shooting ability
